meanings.definition: Capable of being bent easily without breaking.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was flexile, stretching without snapping.
meanings.sent2: The yoga instructor demonstrated the flexile nature of the spine.
meanings.sent3: The flexile straw danced in the wind, amusing the children.
meanings.sent4: Her flexile mind could adapt to any situation, like a contortionist.
meanings.sent5: The flexile branches of the willow tree swayed gracefully in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: The flexile schedule allowed for changes without difficulty.
meanings.sent2: The flexile fabric could be transformed into various styles.
meanings.sent3: The flexile cat adjusted to its new home with ease, amusing the family.
meanings.sent4: Her flexile personality could fit into any social group, like a chameleon.
meanings.sent5: The flexile plan could be modified to suit different needs effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Able to be bent or twisted easily.
meanings.sent1: The flexile wire could be shaped into intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The flexile tree branches swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The flexile toy contorted into amusing shapes, entertaining the children.
meanings.sent4: His flexile body moved with the fluidity of a dancer.
meanings.sent5: The flexile material twisted and turned like a snake in his hands.
